duty.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant owned, controlled, maintained, and/or occupied the building and had responsibility for the adjacent sidewalk and an obligation to keep it reasonably safe for invited users (delivery persons). These factual allegations adequately plead a landowner duty.

breach.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific conduct: Defendant shoveled only a narrow path, failed to apply de-icing material, ignored tenant texts/photos notifying her of the ice, and otherwise failed to take reasonable remedial or warning measures—facts that adequately plead a breach of the duty to maintain the sidewalk safely.

causation_but_for.reasoning: Complaint alleges the icy zone created by Defendant’s narrow-shoveling/no-deicer practice caused Plaintiff’s feet to slip and led to her fall and injury. Those allegations sufficiently plead that the injury would not have occurred but for the hazardous icy condition created/maintained by Defendant.

causation_proximate.reasoning: Complaint alleges the harm (slip-and-fall on ice) was a foreseeable consequence of leaving an untreated, refrozen shoveled path and that Defendant had notice of the condition. Those facts adequately plead proximate (foreseeable) causation.

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges concrete special damages (approx. $2,500 medical expenses and $800 lost wages) and general damages for pain and suffering — facts sufficient to plead actual damages.
